Trial_Design.evidence: 40 American Society of Anesthesiologists grade ASA I and II patients

Participants.evidence: 40 American Society of Anesthesiologists grade ASA I and II patients scheduled for elective surgery

Intervention.evidence: In group I (Index Finger group), the LMA was inserted by the classic index finger technique and, in group T (Thumb Insertion group), the thumb insertion technique was used.

Objective.evidence: We evaluated the efficacy of an alternative technique, for insertion of the silicone laryngeal mask airway (LMA) Classic™

Method_Outcome.evidence: Ease of insertion, fiberoptic laryngoscopic position, cuff pressures and laryngopharyngeal morbidity were assessed in both study groups.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 40 American Society of Anesthesiologists grade ASA I and II patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: On statistical analysis, both groups were comparable in all respects.
